conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the forces acting on blocks A and B, considering the angles and the pulley system.

The image shows a setup with a smooth slope inclined at 30°. A light rope is connected to block A at the top of the slope and passes through two pulleys. The other end of the rope is fixed to the ceiling. Block B is hanging from the rope, and the angle of the rope on both sides of the pulley is 90°.
The force of gravity acting on block A is resolved into two components: one parallel to the slope (mg sin 30°) and one perpendicular to the slope (mg cos 30°).
The component parallel to the slope (mg sin 30°) is balanced by the tension in the rope (T) on the left side of the pulley.

premise: The angle of the rope on both sides of the pulley is 90°.
conclusion: The tension on the right side of the pulley (T') is perpendicular to the slope.

premise: The tension on the right side of the pulley (T') is perpendicular to the slope.
conclusion: The component of the tension on the right side of the pulley (T' cos 30°) balances the weight of block B (mg_B).
The tension on the left side of the pulley (T) equals the tension on the right side (T').
Since T = T', we have T cos 30° = mg.

premise: Equating the two expressions for tension.

conclusion: Solving for mg_B, we find mg_B = mg * cos 30°.
The mass of block B is mg * cos 30° / g = m * cos 30°.
